#Newline
  • ENOBARBYS in Cleopatra: Age cannot wither her#Comma nor custom stale Her infinite variety. Other women cloy The appetites they feed#Comma but she makes hungry Where most she satisfies.
    • #Newline
  • ENOBARBYS in Cleopatra: The barge she sat in#Comma like a burnish'd throne#Comma Burn'd on the water. The poop was beaten gold; Purple the sails#Comma and so perfumed that The winds were love-sick with them; the oars were silver#Comma Which to the tune of flutes kept stroke and made The water which they beat to follow faster#Comma As amorous of their strokes. For her own person#Comma It beggar'd all description.
    • #Newline
  • HAMLET in Hamlet: O! that this too too solid flesh would melt#Comma Thaw#Comma and resolve itself into a dew. Or that the Everlasting had not fix'd His canon 'gainst self-slaughter! O God! O God! How weary#Comma stale#Comma flat#Comma and unprofitable#Comma Seem to me all the uses of this world! #Newline

  • HAMLET in Hamlet: To be#Comma or not to be - that is the question; Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune#Comma Or to take arms against a sea of troubles#Comma And by opposing end them? To die#Comma to sleep - No more; and by a sleep to say we end The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks That flesh is heir to#Comma 'tis a consummation Devoutly to be wish'd. To die#Comma to sleep; To sleep#Comma perchance to dream. Ay#Comma there's the rub; For in that sleep of death what dreams may come#Comma When we have shuffled off this mortal coil#Comma Must give us pause. #Newline
